com.pb.sawdust.tabledata

Class AbstractDataTable.DataTablePartition

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.pb.sawdust.tabledata.AbstractDataTable
      • com.pb.sawdust.tabledata.AbstractDataTable.DataTablePartition
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    DataTable, java.lang.Iterable<DataRow>
    Enclosing class:
    AbstractDataTable

    protected static class AbstractDataTable.DataTablePartition
extends AbstractDataTable
    The DataTablePartition class provides a basic data table partition which can be used to fulfill the DataTable.getTablePartition(int,int) method.

    Instances of this class provide a view into the underlying table, so changes in it are reflected here. As required, instances of this class cannot modify the underlying table; however, the underlying table may be changed after the partition instance is created, causing inconsistencies and/or errors. Therefore, care must be taken if a partition is created for a table which may be subsequently modified.

    • Constructor Detail

      • AbstractDataTable.DataTablePartition

        protected AbstractDataTable.DataTablePartition(AbstractDataTable parentTable,
                                    int start,
                                    int end,
                                    boolean coersionOn)
        Constructor specifying the start (inclusive) and end (exclusive) of the table partition.
        Parameters:
        parentTable - The table to partition.
        start - The (0-based) row number to start the partition at.
        end - The (0-based) row number to end the partition at (exclusive).
        coersionOn - If true, then data coersion is will be enabled in the table partition.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if start or end are less than zero, greater than or equal to the number of rows in the underlying table, or if start >= end.

    • Method Detail

      • addColumnToData

        protected <A> boolean addColumnToData(java.lang.String columnLabel,
                          A columnDataArray,
                          DataType type)
        Add a column to this data table. This method's specification is identical to com.pb.sawdust.tabledata.DataTable#addColumn(String, Object, DataType), except that it should not check to ensure that columnDataArray is an array nor update the table schema. That is, this class' implementation of the above specified method already carries out those tasks, leaving the user to implement this method, which only adds the column to the data table. This method is optional and need not be implemented (with anything more than a shell method), though in such a case, the com.pb.sawdust.tabledata.DataTable#addColumn(String, Object, DataType) should be overridden to throw an UnsupportedOperationException.
        Specified by:
        addColumnToData in class AbstractDataTable
        Parameters:
        columnLabel - The label for the new column.
        columnDataArray - The new column data for the existing rows in the data table. This must be a java array (this is generified to allow for primitive and object arrays), with one entry for each row, matching the current row ordering of the data table.
        type - The data type of the new column.
        Returns:
        true if the column was added successfully, false otherwise.
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - since the table partition cannot modify the underlying table.
        See Also:
        DataTable.addColumn(String, Object, DataType)

      • addRow

        protected boolean addRow(int nextRowIndex,
             java.lang.Object... rowData)
        Add a row of data to this data table, with the next row index specified. Specifying the next row index explicitly, as opposed to calling getRowCount() internally, allows for efficiency gains in some instances (such as when using addDataByRow(Object[][])). This method is intended to replace (or wrap) the various addRow methods in the DataTable interface. This method is optional, and it need not be implemented (with anything more than a shell method), though in such a case, the addRow methods should be overridden to throw an UnsupportedOperationException.
        Specified by:
        addRow in class AbstractDataTable
        Parameters:
        nextRowIndex - The next row index in the data table. This value will be identical to a call to getRowCount().
        rowData - The row to add. Consistency checking (column names, types, etc. between row and this data table) may not be performed.
        Returns:
        true if the row was added successfully, false otherwise.
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - since the table partition cannot modify the underlying table.

      • deleteColumnFromData

        protected void deleteColumnFromData(int columnNumber)
        Delete the specified column from this table. This method should not check the input parameter for validity, and should perform no other tasks on the table or its associated data. This method is optional, and it need not be implemented (with anything more than a shell method), though in such a case, the deleteColumn methods should be overridden to throw an UnsupportedOperationException.
        Specified by:
        deleteColumnFromData in class AbstractDataTable
        Parameters:
        columnNumber - The (0-based) index of the column to delete.
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - since the table partition cannot modify the underlying table.

      • deleteRowFromData

        protected void deleteRowFromData(int rowNumber)
        Delete the specified row from this table. This method should not check the input parameter for validity, and should perform no other tasks on the table or its associated data. This method is optional, and it need not be implemented (with anything more than a shell method), though in such a case, the deleteRow methods should be overridden to throw an UnsupportedOperationException.
        Specified by:
        deleteRowFromData in class AbstractDataTable
        Parameters:
        rowNumber - The (0-based) number of the row to delete.
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - since the table partition cannot modify the underlying table.

      • setCellValueInData

        protected boolean setCellValueInData(int rowNumber,
                         int columnIndex,
                         java.lang.Object value)
        Set the value of a cell in this table. This method should not check the row and column number parameters for validity, but it should throw an exception if the value does not match the column's specified data type. This method is optional, and it need not be implemented (with anything more than a shell method), though in such a case, the setCellValue, setRowData, and setColumnData methods should be overridden to throw an UnsupportedOperationException (or to be implemented to not use this method).
        Specified by:
        setCellValueInData in class AbstractDataTable
        Parameters:
        rowNumber - The (0-based) row number of the cell to be changed.
        columnIndex - The (0-based) column index of the cell to be changed.
        value - The value to set in the cell.
        Returns:
        true if the cell was updated successfully, false otherwise.
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - since the table partition cannot modify the underlying table.

      • getTablePartition

        public DataTable getTablePartition(int start,
                          int end)
        Description copied from interface: DataTable
        Get a view of this table corresponding to a range of rows. The start point of the partition is inclusive, and the end point is exclusive. The returned DataTable should be unmodifiable (it cannot itself be modified, nor can it modify the underlying table). There are no specifications as to whether the returned table is a "snapshot" at the time of the method call, or if it is a dynamic view that will change as the underlying table does. Because of this, this method should generally be reserved for fixed (unchanging) data tables.
        Specified by:
        getTablePartition in interface DataTable
        Overrides:
        getTablePartition in class AbstractDataTable
        Parameters:
        start - The (0-based) row number to start the partition at.
        end - The (0-based) row number to end the partition at (exclusive).
        Returns:
        a view of this table from row start up to row end.
